intro: Cheiridopsis rostrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the mesembryanthemum family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in arid gardens and rockeries.
